page.title: 14Sources of News in C M
page.content: The local newspaper is the "North Devon Journal Herald" which was started in 1884. It covers all types of news, has a "Readers Letters" page, sports page, public notices, and several pages of items for sale - mainly house property and cars. The cost is 16p. There are also two free weekly newspapers, the "Advertiser" which started in 1978 and the "Gazette" which was first delivered in 1983. They both contain items of local news and are financed by their advertisments. In 1976 a TV mast was erected in the village. This has enabled almost every home to receive good clear BBC1, BBC2 and ITV pictures. Channel 4 is not yet available. In 1982 Devon Local Radio started and broadcasts for 96 hours each week.
